alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 4:24PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Dale, Henry and northwestern Clay Counties through 615 PM EDT/515 PM CDT/... At 524 PM EDT/424 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Richards Crossroads to 8 miles west of Abbeville to 6 miles southeast of Doster. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Ariton, Newville, Shorterville, Bells Crossroads, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Edwin, Standleys Store, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Pecan, Mabson, Arguta, Snells Crossroads, Graball, Dancey, Thomas Mill Creek and Jones Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
